text:
Hey Sean,
you're not blind - it's not documented. I assume you can't document something that is different to everybody.

You have several possible ways to go. But since the font don't change that often I'll describe the easiest/quickest one.

• upload your custom font to the design-manager
• open the theme-override.css(if you working with the boilerplate) or your main css file(if you go the "one css file to rule them all" way
• implement the fonts with @font-face 
• write your h1-h6, font stylings as you  need
Done
you don't have to write it into the fields.json. Delete the whole font-family thing from the fields.json if you don't need it

I would say: It's not possible without a for-loop.

But to try to help you:
Create a custom module with this function.
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/building-blocks/module-theme-fields#hubdb-row>
